title: What's the difference between voice and tense? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is a huge difference between Voice and tense. Voice defines the way … in which a sentence is declared. Voice can be of two types i.e. active and passive voice. Tense means the form of any declared sentence or when a verb is being done. Tenses can be mainly of three types…. Present, past and future but it can also b further divided into simple, continuous,perfect and perfect continuous.! Thankyou
